programmes.show_description: The weird and wonderful Hen Ogledd, the collaborative project of Richard Dawson, Rhodri Davies, Dawn Bothwell and Sally Pilkington pick an hour of  music to discombobulate you.
Earth, Wind & Fire's Ralph Johnson with the finest Jazz from the 60's & 70's. Tonight including selections from Oliver Nelson, Stanley Turrentine, Brother Jack McDuff & Deodato.
Earth, Wind & Fire's Ralph Johnson with the finest Jazz from the 60's & 70's. Tonight including selections from Lee Morgan, Horace Silver, Joe Henderson & John Coltrane.
Chapman-Whitney Streetwalkers are live in concert from 1975, and there are sessions by Sleepy Jackson, and Wild Strawberries.
Soundtrack the early hours with back to back music, plus exclusive BBC sessions.
Amy Lamé sits in with the early morning breakfast show. Get in touch with your requests - WhatsApp 03700 100 600 or text 64046.
Kyla Harris and Elena Saurel talk to Nemone about their BBC comedy We Might Regret This.
Singer, songwriter, and multidisciplinary artist Yaya Bey joins Jamz for a chat and shares her musical DNA.
Actor Asa Butterfield chats to Craig about his new film 'Stitch Head', his love of music, and mashing up Wheatus and XTC.
Huw has handpicked music, old and new, plus we round up the gigs, shows and festivals that everybody is talking about in today's Gig Lisztomania.
Zac Lawrence from DEADLETTER and comedian Amy Mason join Huw on his weekly Roundtable panel where a range of guests review the latest music releases.
Multidisciplinary artist, DJ and producer FAUZIA delivers this week's guest mix after having released her first new solo music in four years.
Gideon Coe with his music loves from every era and genre.
4/4. 6 Music Festival 2026 headliner Courtney Barnett shares her songwriting inspirations.
Get your fix of all the best new releases in one handy playlist.
Buck Meek, formerly of Big Thief, breaks down his new record, while Peaches is back and on fine form, and electronic master Apparat details his new, eclectic album.
6 Music takes you through the early hours playing back to back music.
6 Music goes back to the 90s!
6 Music goes back to the 00s!
Chris Hawkins takes you through 30 minutes of remixed, re-versioned and re-imagined tracks. Featuring Tame Impala, Nubiyan Twist, Declan McKenna and more .
New music and the biggest Friday bangers with Amy Lamé. Plus a fifth and final pick from this week's 5 before 6 DJ.
Nick welcomes one of his all-time favourite artists, Labi Siffre, to the show to talk about his career and brand new music.
Jamz brings a great selection of tunes to kick-start your weekend.
Craig spins some joyous tunes to get your weekend started, before opening up the Trunk of Funk!
It's Friday, so Huw is out to prove that any song sounds better when it's played on 6 Music by Huw Stephens - so let us know what you want to hear.

programmes.show_name: The People's Party with Femi Koleoso
programmes.show_description: The British soul and R&B singer, known for his first major single 'Space Rider', reveals the soulful tracks that pair with his different Friday nights.
Nathan brings the Friday night indie club vibes with music from Wet Leg and White Denim!
Clothing and fashion-themed indie from Vaccines, Pulp, Circa Waves, PJ Harvey and more!

programmes.show_name: The 6 Mix with Mary Anne Hobbs
programmes.show_description: Producer and DJ Stenny takes over the 6 Mix off the back of his new release Sharp Fragments on the Ilian tape imprint.
